alert.note: Alert for South Central Elko County; Southwest Elko County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 31 at 1:57PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: .Considerable monsoon moisture will push into central Nevada through tonight and expand into northern Nevada Monday. The strongest thunderstorms will have the potential for heavy rain. Flash flooding will be a threat for burn scars, vulnerable canyons and backcountry roads where drainage may be poor. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of eastern Nevada, north central Nevada and northeast Nevada, including the following areas, in eastern Nevada, White Pine County. In north central Nevada, Northern Lander County and Northern Eureka County and Southern Lander County and Southern Eureka County. In northeast Nevada, Northern Elko County, Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range, South Central Elko County, Southeastern Elko County and Southwest Elko County. * WHEN...From Monday morning through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Strong thunderstorms will have the potential to generate heavy rain with rates of 1 to 2 inches an hour. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: South Central Elko County; Southwest Elko County
